comment._content: Great color formation of four Douglas A-4C Skyhawk over runway flying image with undercarriages down, perhaps leading edge slats deployed and because of deep shadow, trailing edge flaps unable to be discerned A-4C 149505 Modex 548 A-4C 145092 Modex 542 A-4C 148450 Modex 5?? A-4C 147834 Modex 543 Tail code NJ of VA-125 ‘Rough Raiders’ Pacific coast A-4 Skyhawk Replacement Air Group htmlimg1.scribdassets.com/5qn7mi6yf41cowml/images/76-9ce0... ………………………………………………………………………………………. A4D-2N/A-4C 149505 flew with VA-125 from April 1962 to 1965 and from September 1965 to September 1973 and served with four active combat Navy squadrons, becoming a Vietnam veteran, plus one in theater US Marine unit, suffering damaged by AAA while operating from Chu Lai Air Base before ancillary service then desert storage. Much later it may have been chosen for sale to Malaysia as an A-4PTM but this never occurred. A-4C 149505 was seen at Memphis Naval Air Technical Training Center on October 21, 1975. This plane was then recorded on NATTC parking ramp at NAS Pensacola, FL on December 27, 2004. A-4C 149505 was noted in April 2013 still in a rear storage lot at the National Museum of Naval Aviation, Pensacola, Florida Perhaps the record of A-4C 149505 as a combat veteran and survival as an instructional airframe made it possible for the National Naval Aviation Museum to acquire it for eventual restoration and display 1963/1964 picture of A-4C 149505 with VA-125: a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-va-125-and-whizzer-white-2226 A-4C 149505 VA-125 Modex: NJ-548 1963 - 1964 Photo Credit: by and from Whizzer White Lieutenant Ken Holthaus is flying Rough Raiders Skyhawk BuNo 149505, NJ 548, from NAS Lemoore, California to NAS Fallon, Nevada for Detachment work 1966 picture of A-4C 149505 with VA-93: a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-va-93-us-navy-paul-cassiman-... A-4C 149505 VA-93 Modex: NG-316 USS Enterprise 1966 Photo Credit: U.S. Navy from Paul Cassiman James Hensley Blue Blazers Skyhawk BuNo 149505, NG 316, assigned to LTJG S. E. Woodburn on the Enterprise catapult. The photograph is interesting because 316 appears to be loaded with ten Mk 81s. The holdback fitting is attached, and it looks like the "Ordies" are going through the final arming process. The bridle has yet to be hooked up. In the background BuNo 149551, NG 301, is moving onto the starboard catapult 1965 photo with A-4C 149505 included: a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-va-93-official-us-navy-photo... A-4C 149505 VA-93 Modex: NG-316 Date: 1965 official U.S. Navy photo from Paul Cassiman Blue Blazer flight is about to go feet dry in South Vietnam. BuNo 147834, NG 311, is leading the division in right echelon formation. BuNo 147710, NG 310, is flying on his wing. The section leader is flying BuNo 149551, NG 301 Bill Larkins 1966 picture including A-4C 149505: a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-va-93-ng-316 A-4C 149505 VA-93 Modex: NG-316 Location: CVN-65 USS Enterprise passing under the Golden Gate Bridge Date: 21 JUN 1966 Photo Credit: Willam T. Larkins A-4C 149505 of VC-7 with side number 20, picture dated 1970 a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-vc-7-unknown-w-mutza-2229 left front view of Tally-Hoers Skyhawk BuNo 149505, UH-20, assigned to LT "Tut" Tuttle parked on the ramp with a Delmar tow target on the port pylon. Year 2010 picture of A-4C 149505: www.abpic.co.uk/popup.php?q=1361811 A-4C 149505 NATTC MEMPHIS 004 MARINES Date: 10 April 2010 Seen in storage area of National Naval Aviation Museum, Pensacola NAS, Pensacola, Florida (NTTC stands for Naval Air Technical Training Center) Another year 2010 picture of A-4C 149505: www.flickr.com/photos/34709414@N02/8300708334/ A-4C 149505 NATTC MEMPHIS 004 MARINES Seen in storage area of National Naval Aviation Museum, Pensacola NAS, Pensacola, Florida Date: April 20, 2010 Year 2007 picture of A-4C 149505: a4skyhawk.org/content/149505-national-museum-naval-aviati... A-4C 149505 National Museum of Naval Aviation Modex: NATTC MEMPHIS 004 NAS Pensacola Florida 2007 Photo Credit: Richard Lane On the restoration flight line March 2012 picture of A-4C 149505: a4skyhawk.org/content/national-naval-aviation-museum-149505 A-4C 149505 NATTC MEMPHIS 004 MARINES Location: National Naval Aviation Museum Date: 21 March 2012 Photo Credit: M. Vandeweert A-4C Skyhawk BuNo 149505 on the back lot of the National Naval Aviation Museum. Another March 2012 picture of A-4C 149505 a4skyhawk.org/content/national-naval-aviation-museum-1495... A-4C 149505 NATTC MEMPHIS 004 MARINES Location: National Naval Aviation Museum Date: 21 March 2012 Photo Credit: M. Vandeweert A-4C Skyhawk BuNo 149505 on the back lot of the National Naval Aviation Museum. October 2012 picture of A-4C 149505 www.aerialvisuals.ca/AirframePhotoViewer.php?Serial=13225 Airframe: Douglas A-4C Skyhawk, s/n 149505 USN Photographer: Glenn Chatfield Date Photographed: On 8 October 2012 Seen in close packed rear storage area of National Naval Aviation Museum, Pensacola NAS, Pensacola, Florida ………………………………………………………………………………………. A4D-2N/A-4C 145092 flew with VA-125 from April 1960 to 1967 then serving with with two active Navy squadrons VA-195 ‘Dambusters’ on CVA-14 USS Ticonderoga with CVW-19 code NM possibly during a Vietnam War deployment & VSF-1 as Modex 510 code AG of CVW-7 for a short North Atlantic cruise aboard CVA-62 USS Independence Sept-Oct 1969 before Naval Reserve service and update to A-4L plus Navy ancillary service - then storage at the then MASDC in Arizona from December 16, 1975. Struck Off on August 19, 1977 and five years later refurbished and sold to Malaysia as an A-4PTM, becoming ‘M32-14’. a4skyhawk.org/2e/malaysia/malaysia.htm 145092: 19AUG77 A-4PTM M32-14 A4D-2N/A-4C/A-4L/A-4PTM 145092/M32-14 still exists in Malaysia as an instructional airframe A-4C 145092 seen when with the Naval reserve: a4skyhawk.org/content/145092-nas-pt-mugu-wings-magazine-p... A-4C 145092 7L-46 NAS Pt. Mugu Wings magazine, photo by Ron Picciani left front view of NAS Pt. Mugu Skyhawk BuNo 145092, 7L-46, parked on the ramp 1970s picture of three Reserve squadron VA-203 A-4L’s with 145092 included: a4skyhawk.org/content/145092-va-203-dave-dollarhide-1266 A-4L 145092 VA-203 Modex: AF-316 air-to-air Date: early 1970's Photo Credit: Dave Dollarhide BuNo.149635, BuNo.145092 BuNo.149633 in formation during a weapons detachment at NAS Fallon. The blue dolphin on the drop tanks is being phased out "World Famous" no longer accompanied "Blue Dolphins" on the avionics hump Picture of A-4L 145092 with VC-13 ‘Saints’: a4skyhawk.org/content/145092-vc-13-wings-magazine-photo-r... A-4L 145092 VC-13 Modex: UX-1 North Island, CA Wings magazine, photo by Ron Picciani left front view of VC-13 Saints Skyhawk BuNo 145092, UX-1, parked on the ramp A 1975 picture of A-4L 145092 with VC-13 ‘Saints’: a4skyhawk.org/content/145092-vc-13-unknown-w-mutza-1271 A-4L 145092 VC-13 Modex: UX-1 North Island, CA Date: 21 September 1975 right front view of Saints Skyhawk BuNo 145092, UX-1, parked on the ramp A 1976 picture of A-4L 145092 with VC-13 ‘Saints’ (in monochrome): a4skyhawk.org/content/vc-13-saints-4l-buno-145092 A-4L 145092 VC-13 Modex: UX-1 NAS Miramar, CA - 1976 ? Photo Credit: R.W. Harrison Right rear view of VC-13 Saints A-4L Skyhawk BuNo 145092, UX-1, on the ramp at NASMiramar, 1976. Name below the canopy rail is CDR Carter. A 1982 picture of A-4L 145092 in pre delivery primer and Malaysian markings: a4skyhawk.org/content/145092-malaysia-wings-magazine-phot... A-4PTM Malaysia BuNo: 145092 Modex: 14 Wings magazine, photo by Ron Picciani right rear view of Malaysia Skyhawk BuNo 145092, #14, about to touch down. A 1992 picture of A-4L 145092 – or A-4PTM M32-14 of the Malaysian Air Force : www.myaviation.net/search/photo_search.php?id=01643442 www.myaviation.net/search/search.php?view=&regnr=M32-14 A-4PTM M32-14 at Paya Lebar Singapore September 19, 1992 in open storage with several others A 2013 picture of A-4L 145092 – or A-4PTM M32-14 as an instructional airframe attached to a Malaysian University: www.airfighters.com/photo/116669/M/Malaysia-Air-Force/Dou... A-4PTM M32-14 Universiti Sains Malaysia/ School of Aerospace Engineering Pulau Pinang Malaysia March 26, 2013 ………………………………………………………………………………………. A4D-2N/A-4C 148450 flew with VA-125 from September 1963 to March 1969 and two active Navy units before that. Then with a utility unit out of Hawaii before desert storage and sale in 1976 to Argentina with their air force as A-4P C-310. A-4C 148450 Construction Number 12643, Fuerza Aerea Argentina A-4P C-310 was shot down during the Argentine/British Falklands/Malvinas Islands hostilities on May 30 1982 by Sea Dart surface to air missile fired by British Royal Navy Type 42 destroyer D-89 HMS Exeter off East Falkland Island during an attack on HMS Invincible. Pilot Capitan Omar Jesus Castillo was Killed In Action. a4skyhawk.org/2e/argentina/falklands-malvinas/argentina-m... a4skyhawk.org/2e/argentina/argentina-af4th5th.htm www.naval-history.net/F64argaircraftlost.htm 30 MAY 1982: Two Argentine Super Etendards, one equipped with an Exocet missile, attack the British Task Force containing the two British Aircraft Carriers. According to the Argentine account the carrier HMS Invincible was struck. The British account states the missile passed between HMS Exeter and HMS Avenger. HMS Invincible returned to England showing no damage to the carrier. As a planned follow-up attack to the Exocet attack, four Argentine Air Force Escuadron I Grupo 4 Skyhawks with 500 lb. bombs attack what they believe was the target of the "Exocet", the Invincible. However what they find is the HMS Avenger and the nearby HMS Exeter. Exeter shoots down two Grupo 4 Skyhawks using Sea Dart Missiles. First Lieutenant Vazquez in C-301 and First Lieutenant Castillo in C-310 were killed in this action. First Lieutenant E. Ureta, First Lieutenant Alférez G. Isaac were able to return to their base convinced the attack was against the Invincible 1967 image with A-4C 148450 included: a4skyhawk.org/content/buno-148450-va-125-lemoore-nj-546 A-4C 148450 VA-125 ‘Rough Raiders’ Modex: NJ-546 NAS Lemoore Circa 1967 Photo Credit: U.S. Navy Group shot of the different Skyhawk versions that operated at NAS Lemoore with VA-125. From left to right: A-4A; BuNo 139927, NJ-307; A-4B BuNo 145024, NJ-583; A-4C BuNo 148450, NJ-546; A-4E BuNo 149998; an A-4F and a TA-4F. Stirring picture A-4C 148450 about to land on super carrier USS Kitty Hawk in 1963: a4skyhawk.org/content/148450-va-113-photo-jerry-kopff-1874 A-4C 148450 VA-113 Modex: NH-310 USS Kitty Hawk circa 1963 photo by Jerry Kopff right side view of Stingers Skyhawk BuNo 148450, NH-310, over the round down prior to an arrested landing aboard the Kitty Hawk ………………………………………………………………………………………. A4D-2N/A-4C 147834 flew with VA-125 and three active Pacific Fleet Navy units during its time. From recent info, it is currently in 3 pieces marked as 148592 in the grounds of defunct Florida Military Aviation Museum located 3 miles south on Highway 17 from Fort Meade approximately 20 miles south from Lakeland a4skyhawk.org/content/147834-va-216-photo-takafumi-hiroe-... A-4C 147834 VA-216 ‘Black Diamonds’ Modex 602 tail code NL of CVW-15 CVA-43 USS Coral Sea 1968-1969 a4skyhawk.org/content/147834-vc-5-photograph-warren-harms... 1969 Photograph by Warren A. Harms Checkertails Detachment Cubi Skyhawk BuNo 147834, UE 27, leads Checkertail Skyhawk BuNo 147752, UE 28 in a section takeoff from NAS Cubi Point, Olongapo, Philippines on their way to DaNang, South Vietnam All information courtesy membership of the “A-4 Skyhawk Association”
